net.proteusframework.ui.miwt.data

Class SQLTableModelColumn

  • java.lang.Object
    • net.proteusframework.ui.miwt.data.SQLTableModelColumn

  • public class SQLTableModelColumn
extends java.lang.Object
    Defines a column for a SQLTableModel object.
    Author:
    Pat B. Double (double@i2rd.com)

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      protected boolean canOrder
      Determines if ordering can (or should) be done for this column.
      (package private) SortOrder currentOrder
      Determines the current ordering.
      (package private) java.lang.Class dataClass
      The class of the Object returned by the ResultSet.getObject() method.
      protected SortOrder defaultOrder
      Determines the default ordering.
      protected java.lang.String displayName
      The name of the column to display.
      protected java.lang.String fieldName
      The field name for the column.
      (package private) int rstColumnIndex
      The column index.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      SQLTableModelColumn(java.lang.String name)
      Creates an instance with the display name and field name the same, canOrder=true and defaultOrder=SortOrder.ASCENDING.
      SQLTableModelColumn(java.lang.String displayName, java.lang.String fieldName)
      Creates an instance with canOrder=true and defaultOrder=SortOrder.ASCENDING
      SQLTableModelColumn(java.lang.String displayName, java.lang.String fieldName, boolean canOrder, SortOrder defaultOrder)
      Create an instance with the given parameters.

    • Field Detail

      • canOrder

        protected boolean canOrder
        Determines if ordering can (or should) be done for this column.

      • currentOrder

        SortOrder currentOrder
        Determines the current ordering. This value is set by the SQLTableModel.

      • dataClass

        java.lang.Class dataClass
        The class of the Object returned by the ResultSet.getObject() method. This value is set by the SQLTableModel.

      • defaultOrder

        protected SortOrder defaultOrder
        Determines the default ordering.

      • displayName

        protected java.lang.String displayName
        The name of the column to display.

      • fieldName

        protected java.lang.String fieldName
        The field name for the column.

      • rstColumnIndex

        int rstColumnIndex
        The column index. This value is set by the SQLTableModel.

    • Constructor Detail

      • SQLTableModelColumn

        public SQLTableModelColumn(java.lang.String name)
        Creates an instance with the display name and field name the same, canOrder=true and defaultOrder=SortOrder.ASCENDING.
        Parameters:
        name - The field name

      • SQLTableModelColumn

        public SQLTableModelColumn(java.lang.String displayName,
                           java.lang.String fieldName)
        Creates an instance with canOrder=true and defaultOrder=SortOrder.ASCENDING
        Parameters:
        displayName - The name to display
        fieldName - The actual field name

      • SQLTableModelColumn

        public SQLTableModelColumn(java.lang.String displayName,
                           java.lang.String fieldName,
                           boolean canOrder,
                           SortOrder defaultOrder)
        Create an instance with the given parameters.
        Parameters:
        displayName - The name to display
        fieldName - The actual field name
        canOrder - true if ordering can be done on this column, false otherwise
        defaultOrder - The default ordering.

        Returns:

      • getDefaultOrder

        public SortOrder getDefaultOrder()
        Get the default sort order for the column. Returns SortOrder.NONE if the column may not be sorted, however the getCanOrder() method should be used to make this determination.
        Returns:
        SortOrder.

      • getDisplayName

        public java.lang.String getDisplayName()

        Set if the column can be sorted.

        canOrder - true if the column can be sorted.

        public void setCurrentOrder(SortOrder order)
        Set the current ordering for the column.
        Parameters:
        order - The sort order, may not be null.
